messageBody:
I am not sure whether your requirement is to provide dynamic inputs
without changing/recompiling your test code. If yes, you may want to
try Jetif which takes declarative parameters from an XML like this...

<method name="testSomething">
<param>42.0</param>
<param handler="array">value1, value2, value3</param>
<param>32</param>
<expected>true</expected>
</method>

It can also return values for each test run. You can also mentioned
the data types for the data you pass.

~JAK

On 4/18/05, Ilja Preuss <preuss@...> wrote:
> junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> > Hii .. I m just starting off in JUnit and wanted to know if there is
> > any way I can test methods which take input from console input instead
> > of me supplying the inputs in JUNIT??.. i dont know if the question is
> > well fromed ..I hope u get the gist.... Thanx in advance
>
> Remember that System.in is a simple InputStream. So, if you'd refactor the
> method you want to test to work on an arbitrary stream instead of just
> System.in, your tests could use some kind of in-memory stream
> (ByteArrayInputStream, for example).
>
> Cheers, Ilja
>
